hotspots.label: Fall Foliage Colors
hotspots.fact: These trees are changing colors because the days are getting shorter and colder. Trees stop making green chlorophyll in fall and we see beautiful reds, oranges, and yellows underneath!

hotspots.label: Fallen Tree Log
hotspots.fact: When trees fall into the water, they become homes for fish, insects, and other animals. This dead wood, called a 'snag,' is super important for forest ecosystems!

hotspots.label: Seasonal Leaf Drop
hotspots.fact: The ground is covered with fallen leaves because deciduous trees drop their leaves in autumn to save water and energy during winter. These leaves decompose and make the soil rich!

hotspots.label: Forest Ecosystem
hotspots.fact: This lake is surrounded by a healthy forest with many different types of trees. Forests provide clean air, clean water, and homes for thousands of animals and plants!
